channel.title: About Me on D00k
channel.description: Recent content in About Me on D00k

item.title: Music
item.description: Currently listening to • Various Studio Ghibli soundtracks by Joe Hisaihi. • Dreamgirl, for some lo fi vibes. • Citypop compilations from Youtube. Music Notes Currently, I’m beginning a journey to move away from Spotify. I’ve begun buying an album a month on Bandcamp, as well as buying CDs when I can (second hand stores are great). I’m hoping to purchase an iPod Classic for portable music, it might become a project as well to add some mods like flash storage.

item.title: Bookmarks
item.description: A small library of various bookmarks and websites I’ve kept over the years. Neatly sorted for ease of use! Webring ∙ XXIIVV Wiki. ∙ RitualDust. ∙ Thomasorus. ∙ Kokorobot. ∙ Fdisk. Web Magazines ∙ Low Tech Magazine. ∙ Real Life Mag. ∙ Compost. ∙ the Orphenyade. Pools of Knowledge ∙ Practical Self Reliance. ∙ Hundred Rabbits. Fun Web Stuff ∙ Marginalia Search Engine. ∙ Kicks Condor.

item.title: Now
item.description: April 2022 ∙ Learning digital art using Krita. ∙ Modifying an iPod Classic. ∙ Working on a Minecraft Museum. ∙ Burning loads of CDs to Digital for my music collection. ∙ Mostly taking the month to rest and get back on my toes after a terrible health month. What’s Playing? ∙ Vibing to Yot Club’s album, Bipolar. ∙ Re-watching some Ghibli movies. ∙ Still playing Pokemon Legends Arceus.

item.title: Colophon
item.description: A comprehensive dive into the design, and creation of this website Background This site was made to scratch an itch I long had. Sharing stuff on social media has never been my mojo, I’ll often post my photography, however I yearned for something more expansive and exciting so I made a website. The first version of the site was made by modifying what I felt was a suitable theme, however I soon became aware of my lack of knowledge in web design and development, scrapping the site soon after I finished it.

item.title: Setup
item.description: A breakdown of the hardware and software I use for making things, or getting things done. Hardware Modified Dell Keyboard ∙ Lenovo Thinkpad E580 Laptop. Cpu - Intel Core I5-8250U Memory - 12GB Storage - 256GB Samsung SSD Display - 1920x1080 LCD OS - Fedora Linux ∙ Generic Dell Keyboard. A full sized, classic membrane Dell Keyboard from the early noughties.
